vulnerability_findings.name: solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in Coordinape.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.8.2 (Coordinape.sol#5): it allows old versions

vulnerability_findings.name: solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in CoordinapeRole.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.8.2 (CoordinapeRole.sol#5): it allows old versions

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(_amount <= allowance.maxAmount, "Amount tapped exceed max allowance");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require

vulnerability_findings.name: use-prefix-decrement-not-postfix
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using the prefix decrement expression whenever the return value is not needed. The prefix decrement expression is cheaper in terms of gas.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(_amount <= allowance.maxAmount, "Amount tapped exceed max allowance");
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.
